item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 18th November
item.description:
Customer asks when the bollard will be replaced, as a temporary sign has been in place for two years now; this is on the ground more than being upright and is a trip hazard. Occasionally, it is stood back up by Highways staff, but the wind blows it down or it's tampered with. Given the time that has elapsed since the original bollard was damaged/removed, they intend to call regularly until the issue is resolved/the bollard is replaced.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Deep Potholes on the road by the speed hump Marsland Road, 18th November
item.description:
There a lots of holes and cracks on the road by the road hump/ traffic calming ramp on Marsland Road by Wilson Drive that is causing danger to motorists and pedestrians and needs to be filled but long term road needs to be resurfaced as soon as possible as patch work is not sufficient. The pothole I highlight by the start of the ramp is visible from Google maps and was filled last year. These temporary measures aren't sufficient or cost effective and would be better resurfaced and would be nice to not have to report potholes all the time for this road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Marsland Road, Fiddler's Green, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 18th November
item.description:
Multiple potholes in Marsland Road. Needs full resurfacing the whole road down to the mini roundabout. Patchwork will not be sufficient and it is now becoming a major problem for vehicles and pedestrians as there are so many dips, holes and cracks. Please organise a resurface of the road as wentworth road was done and other roads off of Marsland Road. There was a report in July of this year and still no good work to rectify the road that is falling apart

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Marsland Road, Fiddler's Green, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pieces of concrete have been left in Horsebere Brook which is regularly cause for concern in terms of flooding, 18th November
item.description:
A large concrete pillar and slabs of concrete path are causing blockages in the flow of the Horsebere Brook just underneath the footbridge next to the park. Given this area is a high flood risk, leaving such obstacles is a huge risk factor. Please could someone remove these blockages asap?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evergreen Walk, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged pedestrian footbridge, 18th November
item.description:
This issue has been re-raised having been previously marked as "Closed" without repair or explanation under FixMyStreet ref: 8409754. The high-traffic public footpath that connects Gloucester Road to Staverton Villiage contains footbridge that crosses Hatherly Brook. This footbridge has damaged wooden slats that have become a dangerous pedestrian trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Priority traffic direction causing major problems, 18th November
item.description:
The priority traffic sign where the road narrows at the south eastern end of Kidnappers Lane near Rectory Court is causing major problems and the removal of the line for priority vehicles has not helped. Cars that do not have priority cannot see the oncoming cars. They proceed tentatively but often are met then by a vehicle convinced that they can speed along as they have the priority and they are often very unpleasant when thwarted. It would be far better to reverse the priority as cars coming along Kidnappers Lane from the west have a clearer view. The situation is stressful and unsustainable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Road marking white lines or studs
